results.title: Gilly, the salamander
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Mimi Lampert
results.brief_description: Because only his egg escaped a catfish massacre, Gilly grows up thinking he is really a too-long frog. Finally, unable to bear the unkind jibes of the frogs, he leaves the pond to find his true identity. When he returns he meets Sally Salamander, who tells him the facts of his life. This film uses the story about a salamander to motivate the practice of language skills and to encourage young children to share experiences in learning about themselves. For primary grades.

results.title: Gillian's Story
results.brief_description: Leanne Wagner pays tribute to her remarkable sister Gillian who has had to battle with Sturge-Weber syndrome, epilepsy, schizophrenia, glaucoma and an intellectial disability.

results.title: Gilbert and Sullivan's Cox and Box: or the long lost brothers
results.brief_description: Gilbert and Sullivan’s well known operetta “Cox and Box.” Performers include: John Fryatt, Russell Smythe, Tom Lawlor. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. Staged by David Alden. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's Trial By Jury
results.brief_description: In a “breach of promise” case, the learned Judge and Jury are somewhat smitten by the pretty Plaintiff’s charms, and the Defendant is hard pressed to explain that indeed he loved this girl once, but fell in love with another. Despite his suggestion that he marry both women, the learned Judge has his own solution - he will marry the Plaintiff himself! Performers include: Frankie Howerd, Ryland Davies, Anna Dawson, Kate Flowers, Tom Mc Donnell. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Wendy Toye. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's the Yeomen of the Guard
results.brief_description: Described as Gilbert and Sullivan’s most romantic opera and subtitled The merryman and his maid, the story tells of the love of Elsie Maynard, daughter of the Sergeant of the Guard at the Tower of London for the dashing Colonel Fairfax, falsely accused of treason and soon to be executed on Tower Green. Performers include: Joel Grey, Alfred Marks, Elizabeth Gale, David Hillman, Elizabeth Bainbridge. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Anthony Besch. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's Ruddigore: or the witch's curse
results.brief_description: Bound by an ancient curse to commit a crime everyday, Sir Despard Murgatroyd is greatly relieved to learn that shy Robin Oakapple is, in fact, the rightful Lord of Ruddigore and victim of the curse. Robin, who has won, and now lost, his etiquette-obsessed sweetheart, Rose Maybud, ultimately calls on his ancestor’s ghost, and his own logic to lift the curse and win back Rose. Performers include: Vincent Price, Keith Michell, John Treleaven, Donald Adams and Sandra Dugdale. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Christopher Renshaw. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's Princess Ida: or Castle Adamant
results.brief_description: Princess Ida was betrothed as a baby to Prince Hilarious - who intends storming the school to take his bride. With her father, King Gama, subtly but none too painfully tortured and her brothers defeated in a fight, Ida agrees to subordinate herself to Hilarious… and love. Performers include: Frank Gorshin, Neil Howlett, Laurence Dale, Bernard Dickerson, Anne Collins. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Terry Gilbert. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's Patience: or Bunthorne's bride
results.brief_description: Lovesick maidens of Castle Bunthorne pursue poet, aesthete, and fake - Reginald Bunthorne. But Bunthorne loves the village milkmaid, Patience, who does not like poetry, nor understand love. When she finally discovers what it means, it is Reginald’s rival whom she decides to marry. Performers include: Derek Hammond-Stroud, John Fryatt, Sandra Dugdale, Anne Collins. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by John Cox. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.
